snippet: Representative John Conyers Jr. of Michigan is short by hundreds of names to qualify for the primary ballot in August.
abstract: Rep John Conyers Jr, who has represented the Detroit area in the House for almost 50 years, is in danger of not making the ballot for an August primary because his petitions may be disqualified for not containing enough signatures; questions about petitions have been repeatedly raised by opponent Rev. Horace Sheffield.
lead_paragraph: Representative John Conyers Jr. of Michigan is short by hundreds of names to qualify for the primary ballot in August.

headline.main: Signatures on Petitions for Conyers Fall Short
headline.print_headline: Signatures on Petitions for Conyers Fall Short
